body: Note that we should probably also add some new examples to the docstring of `st.table`, so we show these capabilities.

issue.title: Add `border` parameter to `st.table`

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Adds a `border` parameter to `st.table`, which allows creating different table styles:

![Screenshot 2025-06-27 at 16 27 53](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cab6faf5-e15a-4edf-9546-87180e2ad80e)

Demo app to show it in combination with other `st.table` features:

![Screenshot 2025-06-27 at 16 27 37](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8ed40230-6e77-44cc-9945-944c6073450c)



## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Closes #11795 

## Testing Plan

- Unit Tests (JS and/or Python) ‚úÖ 
- E2E Tests ‚úÖ 

---

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Add border parameter to st.table() function

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Summary
- Implements the `border` parameter for `st.table()` function as requested in issue
- Allows creating tables without borders for cleaner, more condensed presentation
- Maintains backward compatibility with default `border=True`

## Changes
- Added `border` parameter to `st.table()` function signature in `lib/streamlit/elements/arrow.py`
- Updated Arrow protobuf schema to include `show_borders` field
- Modified frontend ArrowTable component to conditionally render borders
- Updated CSS styling logic in styled-components to hide/show borders based on parameter
- Added test examples in e2e test file

## Test plan
- [x] Function signature accepts `border` parameter with default True
- [x] When `border=False`, table borders are hidden in frontend
- [x] When `border=True` (default), table borders display normally
- [x] Backward compatibility maintained for existing code

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
